No mercy permalink award report block reply Nomad899 1 points 7 days ago Only gangs and criminals have guns in ny…everyone else is at their mercy permalink parent award report block reply Gtsx 2 points 7 days ago If the Supreme Court got of its ass, maybe the same constitution would apply to the whole country. permalink award report block reply AtomicAmericanX 1 points 7 days ago No mon, no fun, your son... permalink award report block reply guns_and_butter 1 points 7 days ago AI is going to obliterate the tax base so good luck funding any of his socialist bullshit. permalink award report block reply SBOJ_JOBS 1 points 6 days ago The state legislature must approve NYC taxes, but if the city management proceeds to spend itself into a hole, upstate legislators will be under enormous pressure to let NYC residents pay themselves back, not put the burden on other taxpayers. Meanwhile... New York City residents face a multi-layered tax system that includes state, city, and local levies. The city imposes its own income tax on top of New York State taxes, with rates ranging from 3.078% to 3.876% depending on income level and filing status, resulting in combined state and city income tax rates between 7.078% and 14.776% for top earners. New York State itself has nine progressive income tax brackets, from 4% to 10.9%. Sales taxes in New York City are among the highest in the nation, with a total rate of 8.875%, including a 0.375% Metropolitan Commuter Transportation District charge.
Property taxes in New York City have an average effective rate of 0.91% of property value, though this is due to the taxable value being set at only 6% of market value for most residential properties. The city’s property tax is a major revenue source, projected to generate $24 billion in fiscal year 2017 and continuing to grow due to rising real estate values. Additionally, residents pay a 25.68 cents per gallon gas tax and a $4.35 per pack cigarette excise tax, with an additional $1.50 per pack in New York City. permalink award report block reply tlorsung 1 points 7 days ago Hay Now! SBOJ_JOBS 1 points 6 days ago The state legislature must approve NYC taxes, but if the city management proceeds to spend itself into a hole, upstate legislators will be under enormous pressure to let NYC residents pay themselves back, not put the burden on other taxpayers. Meanwhile... New York City residents face a multi-layered tax system that includes state, city, and local levies. The city imposes its own income tax on top of New York State taxes, with rates ranging from 3.078% to 3.876% depending on income level and filing status, resulting in combined state and city income tax rates between 7.078% and 14.776% for top earners. New York State itself has nine progressive income tax brackets, from 4% to 10.9%. Sales taxes in New York City are among the highest in the nation, with a total rate of 8.875%, including a 0.375% Metropolitan Commuter Transportation District charge.
Property taxes in New York City have an average effective rate of 0.91% of property value, though this is due to the taxable value being set at only 6% of market value for most residential properties. The city’s property tax is a major revenue source, projected to generate $24 billion in fiscal year 2017 and continuing to grow due to rising real estate values. Additionally, residents pay a 25.68 cents per gallon gas tax and a $4.35 per pack cigarette excise tax, with an additional $1.50 per pack in New York City. permalink award report block reply
